Module 1: Numeric Questions

For students

Last updated: 28/07/2025 13:27

The questions are based on or inspired by the following references:

  • Berk & DeMarzo, Corporate Finance, 5th ed. (2020)
  • Brealey & Myers, Principles of Corporate Finance, 13th ed. (2020)

üìò Part 1 (until Midterm)

Answer the following questions based on the discussions in class.

Login

Post-money valuation and ownership

You founded your company with 0.06 million and received 1 million shares.
You later sold 0.75 million shares to angel investors.
Now a VC wants to invest 3 million in exchange for 2 million shares.

‚úÖ Post-money = (Total shares) √ó (Price per share)
= (3.75) √ó (1.5) = 5.625 million

‚úÖ VC Ownership = 2 / (3.75) √ó 100 = 53.333%

‚úÖ Value = 1 √ó 1.5 = 1.5 million

Capital raised and founder dilution

A company raised capital in three rounds (values in millions USD):

Series A: Pre = 3.368, Post = 6.287

Series B: Pre = 38.243, Post = 77.473

Series C: Pre = 132.115, Post = 184.012

‚úÖ Raised = Post - Pre = 6.287 - 3.368 = 2.919 million

‚úÖ Raised = Post - Pre = 77.473 - 38.243 = 39.23 million

‚úÖ Raised = Post - Pre = 184.012 - 132.115 = 51.897 million

‚úÖ % kept = Pre / Post = 3.368 / 6.287 = 53.571%

‚úÖ % kept = A √ó B = (53.571%) √ó (49.363%) = 26.444%

‚úÖ % kept = A √ó B √ó C = (53.571%) √ó ‚Ä¶ = 18.986%

Post-money valuation and VC ownership

You founded a firm three years ago. You started with $0.226 million, which gave you 1.005 million shares. You later sold 1.918 million shares to angel investors. Now, a VC firm wants to invest $5.401 million in exchange for 2.16 million new shares.

‚úÖ Post-money = Total shares √ó Price per share = (5.083) √ó (2.5) = 12.71 million

‚úÖ VC Ownership = 2.16 / (5.083) √ó 100 = 42.495%

Valuation and Ownership After Equity Issuance

Erica owns all 4 million shares of her company, CoralTech. A new partner is offering to invest 2.008 million in exchange for 1.5 million shares.

‚úÖ Post-money = (5.5) shares √ó $1.339 (2.008/ 1.5) = 7.364 million

‚úÖ Partner Ownership = 1.5 / 5.5 √ó 100 = 27.273%

Ownership After Two Funding Rounds

After a Series A round, the founders owned 68.2% of BetaVision.
Then, Series B investors contributed 5.724 million and received 21.6% of the company.

‚úÖ Founders‚Äô final ownership = (1 - 21.6%) √ó 68.2% = 53.5%

‚úÖ Series A ownership = (1 - 21.6%) √ó 31.8% = 24.9%

Convertible Note with Discount

Context:
Yara invested in a startup using a convertible note of $1.586 million, with a 20% discount.
When the company raised Series A at $1.71 per share, her note converted at the discounted price.

‚úÖ Shares = Note / Discounted Price = 1.586 million / 1.368 = 1.159 million shares
